item.title: Here's My Current Pokemon Legends: Z-A Team Plan
item.description:
Pokemon Legends: Z-A releases on October 16, which is just three weeks away as of this writing. Previews for Pokemon Legends: Z-A have largely been positive, with a few possible criticisms out there about the potentially repetitive nature of Lumiose City as a setting. That may be the case, but going in, I just want to lean into my childhood love for Pokemon. As such, I am more than ready and have been thinking about my main Pokemon team .

Rumors suggest that there will be a total of 230 Pokémon, with more than 170 confirmed so far . With the majority of the Pokemon Legends: Z-A Pokedex known, I figured it was a good time to plan my team. I think, on that note, it's worth highlighting that I typically do this and, of course, this may change based on my time in the game. For example, I am not going to include Yanmega on this list because it's not on the confirmed list (and unfortunately, I don't see it on any Pokemon Legends: Z-A leaked Pokemon lists either). It would absolutely be on my team if it were, but at least for right now, there's no reason to include. It's also worth noting that I am always aiming for decent type coverage without a lot of weaknesses—I don't want a single Pokemon type rolling my whole team—but I am making a team of Pokemon I enjoy based on the critter themselves. That's the main criterion for my Pokemon team: that I just have fun and like the little critters.

I'm also not opposed to using pseudolegendary or legendary Pokemon on my team, but those factors wouldn't be why I chose them, if I did. For my current plan, I have no intention of using any legendary.

My #1 Pokemon Legends Z-A Pick: My Starter

Obviously, early in the game, we're going to pick a starter. I remember being surprised to learn that Chikorita, Tepig, and Totodile were the starters , especially after Pokemon Legends: Arceus pulled one mon from different generations, and we've got two from Gen 2 here. Despite that, my choice here is really simple. I'm going with Totodile , and you could put Totodile against any other starter in Pokemon history, I'm going to pick my little dude.

  • Feraligatr: Water
  • Mega Feraligatr: Water/Dragon (confirmed)

Totodile has been my favorite starter in the franchise ever since I played Pokemon Gold , so this is a super easy addition to my team. I can't say for full certainty that I'll heavily use Mega Feraligatr, as we haven't seen it, but the descriptions of it are fine. Not revolutionary, but fine. Still, I suppose Feraligatr locks in my Water Pokemon + gives me a Water/Dragon in the pocket if I needed the power bump in battle.

My Next Pokemon Legends Z-A Pick: My Ace

I'm not sure Ampharos is normally considered an ace, but every game I've ever used Ampharos? Ampharos slaps. Hands-down. It has never let me down. Ampharos would be my go-to Mega Pokemon, if needed or if applicable, simply because I also love Mega Ampharos' design. The fact that it gives me a secondary Dragon typing makes sense, but I am not too worried about the fact that Feraligatr and Ampharos are both capable of Mega Evolution and take on a Dragon subtyping (again if rumors on Mega Feraligatr prove true).

  • Ampharos: Electric
  • Mega Ampharos: Mega Electric

Pokemon Legends Z-A Pick: Gogoat

Ever since Gogoat was introduced, I've loved it. I'm not entirely excited about a simple Grass type on my team, as I would argue that Gogoat should have a stronger typing overall , but I am still pretty happy with it. If nothing else, between Gogoat and Ampharos, I am not going to have to worry about Water-type Pokemon. They are never really a significant concern anyway, but still, I have to have my Gogoat.

  • Gogoat: Grass

I also own a few goats, so it's just fate that I use Gogoat whenever I can. I've got to show one of my goats off too, right?

Pokemon Legends Z-A Pick: Gallade

I do enjoy a good split evolution in Pokemon, and the way that Gallade/Gardevoir developed over time ensures that I've always had a special place in my heart for Ralts to begin with. Looking at you, Wally.

  • Gallade: Psychic/Fighting

Pokemon Legends Z-A Pick: Aegislash

In general, I love fantasy, so the fact that I can carry a ghost-sword Pokemon around is very cool. I tend to like the "bulkier," in a sense, types (steel, ground, etc.), so Aegislash really checks off a lot of boxes for me . Still, I think I would trade it for a Corviknight if it were in Pokemon Legends Z-A , but overall, I am quite happy to carry this Pokemon around in any team.

  • Aegislash: Ghost/Steel

Pokemon Legends Z-A Pick: Krookodile

Speaking of the bulkier types, Ground would make a strong case for my favorite type . It's definitely up there, so really this slot is a toss-up between Hippowdon and Krookodile. It comes down to a matter of design, and in my head, at least in the upcoming game, Krookodile takes it.

  • Krookodile: Dark/Ground

As a note, I often enjoy having a Bug type on my team even if it's not Yanmega. Still, none of my favorite or preferred Bug Pokemon are on the confirmed roster. I suspect I'll pick one up in an early route and use it until I finish this team if I don't outright choose to adopt it completely. All of that said, it's not too often that I divert from a planned team once I've chosen it.

My Pokemon Legends Z-A Team (As Currently Planned)

  • Feraligatr (Water)
    • Maybe Water/Dragon

  • Ampharos (Electric)
    • Electric/Dragon

  • Gogoat (Grass)
  • Gallade (Psychic/Fighting)
  • Krookodile (Dark/Ground)
  • Aegislash (Steel/Ghost)

Overall, I am pretty happy with this team. As my main team, I just want to have fun and beat the main story, and I think this selection of Pokemon will do that. Just because it bears repeating, I think I would trade Aegislash for Corviknight and swap in a strong Bug-type Pokemon (ones I enjoy anyway) if they were in the game, but overall, choosing from those available now leaves me with a team I am quite happy with. The only real weakness I should be concerned with, I believe, is Fairy-types and especially Mega Clefable . Still, if that's my only weakness and I have Aegislash for those situations, I think it will be a-okay.

Every Confirmed Pokemon in Pokemon Legends: Z-A

As of September 25

item.title: There Are Currently No Plans for Helldivers 3
item.description:
Arrowhead Game Studios CEO Shams Jorjani has recently confirmed that the studio does not have any plans for a Helldivers 2 sequel. While this information may initially seem disappointing to gamers expecting the release of a possible Helldivers 3 , it’s actually good news for Helldivers 2 players, as it means that the title will continue to receive updates for a long time.

Helldivers 2 is a cooperative third-person shooter released in 2024. While the title was initially available only for PS5 and PC, it eventually received an Xbox Series X/S release earlier in 2025. The Xbox release made Helldivers 2 surge in popularity again, nearly tripling its total concurrent player count after the launch.

Arrowhead Will Continue Updating Helldivers 2 As Long as Possible

Arrowhead's CEO, Shams Jorjani, has recently talked about the future of the Helldivers franchise in a Discord post (spotted by GamesRadar). According to Jorjani, there are no plans for Helldivers 3 , as the studio wants to keep coming up with fresh updates for the current game for a long time. Jorjani compared Helldivers 2 to RuneScape , which was originally released around 25 years ago, and simply kept going with more updates, essentially turning the title into a “forever game” and expanding it over time. Jornani’s opinion is not entirely new, though, as other Arrowhead developers have already indicated that they plan to support Helldivers 2 for years to come.

Proof that Arrowhead is serious about supporting the game is that Helldivers 2 already had three updates in September 2025. Two of them were fairly minor hotfixes, but the main Helldivers 2 update was Into the Unjust, which added new enemies, Hive Worlds, fresh missions, and more.

Recent leaks have also indicated that Helldivers 2 will add major customization features in the future. These upcoming features include color customization for ships, armor, and weapons. However, gamers should obviously take these rumors with a grain of salt, as there’s still no official announcement.

While adding more content is always great, Helldivers 2 will likely also have to fix some issues to become the forever game Jorjani intends. Helldivers 2 ’s Steam reviews are currently “Mixed” when only considering the past 30 days, mostly due to performance issues that the popular co-op shooter is having on PC. Arrowhead has already said that it’s aware of these problems and is currently working to improve the stability and performance of the title. However, there’s no official timeline for these problems to be fixed. Hopefully, Arrowhead will continue to work hard to keep the game engaging and maintain its stable state.

59
8.7 /10
9 /10

item.title: Sakura Stand Tier List
item.description:
Sakura Stand invites you to immerse yourself in an incredible world of battles between heroes and villains. Dozens of different Stands are at your disposal, based on both the original JoJo's Bizarre Adventure and other popular anime. But not all of them are equally powerful. This Sakura Stand Tier List ranks them from best to weakest.

The stands in this Roblox battleground experience have unique abilities that can nevertheless have similar effects. This allows you to neutralize certain enemy skills and create various combos.

Sakura Stand Tier List

Unlike most other battleground games, Sakura Stand has a large number of characters, or rather, stands. Of course, they aren't available from the start. Therefore, players must fight and win to earn Tokens and roll banners with stands. Most banners have a pool of units based on characters from the same universe, so you can easily summon the units you want.

For your convenience, we've ranked all the stands in Sakura Stand in the Tier List below. The ranking is based on their performance and versatility in battle.

Best Sakura Stand Units

Even among the SS Tier, there are several particularly powerful characters in Sakura Stand . Using any of them, you can win most battles, provided you master their skills:

  • Gold Experience Requiem - Undoubtedly the strongest stand in this Roblox game, thanks to its damage and unique abilities, although it is difficult to obtain.
  • Green Boy - A must-have if you prefer experimenting with combos.
  • Cid Kageno - This stand has the highest survivability thanks to its healing abilities and is also immune to time-stopping effects.

item.title: All Arcana Cards in Hades 2 (& How to Upgrade Them)
item.description:
Arcana Cards are bonuses in Hades 2 that become permanently available once they are unlocked at Melinoe's Altar of Ashes in the Crossroads. While fans can view information about some of the game's Arcana Cards the first time that they access the altar, they may be curious about the bonuses that will become available to them as they work through that initial batch. This guide is here to address that curiosity, and a list of the Arcana Cards in Hades 2 can be found below.

This guide focuses on detailing the effects provided by Arcana Cards and explaining how those cards are unlocked and upgraded. Players who are confused about how Arcana Cards are equipped are advised to read this guide to Psyche and Grasp in Hades 2 .

How to Unlock Arcana Cards in Hades 2

Use the Alter of Ashes

Players can unlock Arcana Cards through the Altar of Ashes at the entrance to the Training Grounds in the Crossroads . For full clarity, the Training Grounds is the room where players select their Noctural Arms prior to starting a run, and the Altar of Ashes is shown in the preceding image.

Upon interacting with the Altar of Ashes for the first time, players will find a selection of grey Arcana Cards. These cards can be unlocked by selecting them and pressing the "Unlock" input that appears in the bottom-right corner of the screen once the requisite materials have been obtained. In most cases, Ash is required to unlock Arcana Cards, and this guide to earning Ash in Hades 2 will help players amass that material.

Arcana Cards are Rank 1 when they are unlocked, and the "All Arcana Cards" section at the bottom of this guide lists the reagent requirements.

Once a player has unlocked an Arcana Card, any hidden cards that are adjacent to it will be revealed. Players can then continue revealing and unlocking cards until they have access to all of them.

How to Upgrade Arcana Cards in Hades 2

Players can begin upgrading their Arcana Card after they have performed the Consecration of Ashes incantation . To perform those upgrades, players should press the "Insights" input that is displayed in the bottom-right corner of the screen, select the card that is of interest, and then press the "Improve" input (provided that they have the requisite Hades 2 materials). This process can be used to take a Rank 1 Arcana Card to Rank 2 and a Rank 2 Arcana Card to Rank 3, and the "All Arcana Cards" section at the bottom of this guide lists the material requirements for performing those upgrades.

It is possible to temporarily upgrade an Arcana Card to Rank 4 by selecting Circe's Lapis Lazuli Insight during a run.

All Arcana Cards in Hades 2

Arcana Card

Description

Rank Unlock Requirements

Grasp Cost

item.title: Borderlands 4 Players Are Making a Huge Mistake in One of the Game's Side Quests
item.description:
The Vend of the Line side quest in Borderlands 4 is tricking players into messing up their opportunity to grab a legendary weapon as the quest reward. Borderlands 4 has been out for a few weeks, and as the franchise's first true open-world entry, it's filled to the brim with nearly 100 side quests for players to hunt down and complete for major rewards.

Borderlands 4 's Vend of the Line quest is first encountered in the northwestern region of Kairos, Carcadia Burn, in the city of Carcadia which serves as the home of the Electi, a group of ex-Order members who have been effectively exiled and now oppose the will of the Timekeeper. The quest begins when encountering news anchor Penelope Streams for the first time in Carcadia next to one of Borderlands ' signature vending machines. This one is different, however, as on the back is a puzzle that starts the player on a lengthy side quest across Carcadia Burn that culminates in finding a legendary vending machine with players' reward inside.

Borderlands 4 Players Are Missing Out On Vend of the Line Quest Reward

Many Borderlands 4 players have run into a problem with this Vend of the Line quest and its final reward. At the end of the quest, the legendary vending machine allows players to choose just one legendary weapon for a single dollar, shutting down and becoming unusable completely after the choice is made. Some players, out of sheer habit, have hit the "Sell All Junk" button upon approaching this particular vending machine, which the game counts as the machine's one transaction, shutting the machine down and not allowing players to choose their legendary quest reward. Players who've been burned by this have been sounding off online, letting their frustration at the quest known.

It's hard to blame players for forming the habit of automatically hitting the "Sell All Junk" button when approaching Borderlands ' vending machines, as most of the time it's not worth checking their stock, and selling junk becomes all they're good for in most cases. It's even tougher to place blame on the player for this Vend of the Line heartbreak when it's not known that selling junk will count as the legendary vending machine's one use. It's unclear whether developer Gearbox designed the quest reward this way or if it's a bug. Gearbox is almost certainly aware of the issue with how loud affected Borderlands 4 players have been about the issue. It would be a headscratcher if Gearbox intended the quest to work this way, though it's hard to imagine this is the case.

Borderlands 4 has been receiving updates on a weekly basis since its September 12 launch, so if a fix for Vend of the Line's quest reward is in the works, it'll likely be coming sooner rather than later. For now, players who haven't completed Vend of the Line yet should be careful once they reach the end not to sell their junk, ensuring they get to pick a shiny legendary weapon as their well-earned quest reward.
